conclusion: Analyze the path of the liquid from each starting point (A, B, C, and D) through the baffles to the containers.
The liquid from A will first encounter the blue baffle, which is slanted downwards to the right.
The liquid will follow the slope of the blue baffle and move to the right.
After the blue baffle, the liquid will encounter the yellow baffle, which is slanted downwards to the left.
The liquid will follow the slope of the yellow baffle and move to the left.
The liquid will then encounter the red baffle, which is slanted downwards to the right.
The liquid will follow the slope of the red baffle and move to the right.
The liquid will finally reach the opening above container F.
The liquid from B will first encounter the yellow baffle, which is slanted downwards to the left.
The liquid will follow the slope of the yellow baffle and move to the left.
The liquid will then encounter the blue baffle, which is slanted downwards to the right.
The liquid will follow the slope of the blue baffle and move to the right.
The liquid will finally reach the opening above container F.
The liquid from C will first encounter the yellow baffle, which is slanted downwards to the left.
The liquid will follow the slope of the yellow baffle and move to the left.
The liquid will then encounter the blue baffle, which is slanted downwards to the right.
The liquid will follow the slope of the blue baffle and move to the right.
The liquid will finally reach the opening above container F.
The liquid from D will first encounter the green baffle, which is slanted downwards to the left.
The liquid will follow the slope of the green baffle and move to the left.
The liquid will then encounter the cyan baffle, which is slanted downwards to the right.
The liquid will follow the slope of the cyan baffle and move to the right.
